intro: Anemopaegma longipetiolatum, commonly known as the long-petioled anemopaegma, is a member of the Araliaceae family. It is a shrub-like plant characterized by its compound leaves, which are typically opposite and have elongated petioles. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the genus. Its botanical features include a woody stem, hairy leaves, and a preference for moist, shaded environments. It is native to tropical regions of South America and is often found in forest understories.
